values: Look at that. It still jiggles.

Alright, so that last post was kind emo, but I'm cool now, no worry. I just have to evaluate my life again, it won't take long, but I just after to work some stuff around. Wish me luck, I need some serious sleep.

I hate the fact that I can go through life and not worry about the future. Stuff can happen, my life can be on the edge of ruin, and I will walk away like nothing at all happened. It happens too much in my life, but I never feel afraid of the future, I just can't worry about it. I have no clue where my life is leading, for all I know I could be broken tomorrow, and yet that doesn't worry me.

Is something wrong with me?

Okay, alright, well, I now have Xanga, LJ, and Myspace, each for different random reasons.

LJ: It just happened a long time ago

Xanga: School friends

Myspace: To make fun of Hilary Duff to Jared.

I'm pretty sure no one really reads this or cares that I'm even here, but I've been venturing back every once and a while and I finally found time to do this. Anyway, I guess a recap for my life is in order... but where to begin. I have been single for a year offically this month, despite several small possibilities that were better vanquished, and it actually has kind of done me some good. I think I thought I knew more than I did and I've had a lot of time to live and learn. Not saying I would welcome a relationship, I'm just not pushing for one. I am almost done with my Sophmore year and I'm applying for a job at cost plus, all I'm doing is waiting for my last refrence to e-mail me back, or else I got to find someone else.

I haven't gotten enough sleep in the past year... I have to blame that on the fact that I have started acting. It's been fun, but tiring and once a job starts I know it will be worse, but I do plan to go on vacation a couple of times. The job may be a bust, but it would be worth it to Road Trip to L.A. in order to see Ben Folds. That's kind of everything in a nutsehll, nothing really new... anyone want to hang out this summer?

Okay, so two down and two to go, but you get the picture. We had our opening night on Friday and it was amazing, everything went really well, the crowd loved it, and we all had the amazing energy it required. Some people probably got too cocky though, as a turn for the worse soon came.

Second night started fine, everyone was there early, everyone was ready, we did the hokey pokey and did what we could to prepare. Only problem is that some people thought that they were going to do it perfectly, and so our energy level was way down and there was like no motivation. And then came scene three! Sean's mic wasn't on when he came out, one of the girls knocked over a plant on her way running by, and a couple of props were just off stage out of reach. Despite it all we got through fine enough, people still gave us a lot of compliments and seemed to like it at the end. Back stage was horrible though, people were being unruly, people were going in and out of the back door when they shouldn't have, and people were being loud... so much trouble... but I still made it out alive. Monday is going to hurt though.

I would try and be funny right now, but I am trying to recover sleep.

So tired, this won't be long, but there is a lot to say. I have had play practice, 6 hours a day, everyday. Caytlin, if you read this, I won't be able to get to your play, I'm sorry, my director would do so many things to me it's painful to think about. 

I'm in charge of props and because of that, despite the fact that there aren't a lot of props in this play, I am always the last one to leave. While everyone else runs out: on dates, to make out in the parking lot, or to go sleep, I am stuck at school putting everything away. I will be able to update this more, slowly, but I can make time. Also, I may make a friends only journal, but that won't be till the play is over, and I hopefully get a job.

Junior highers are too dramatic.

It's true, my Xanga is insanly filled with the exact same thing (profile pic, tagline, site name etc. etc.), except the background is a pengiun and that's the one thing different. 

I really do not like people who have to be funny in order to be accepted, in order to be loved. They search for the cheap, easy jokes in situations for people to laugh and hang around them a bit longer. I would prefer if these guys took a hint, that every moment we do not need a remark from you, that sometimes it's okay to be silent. This isn't about anyone here and it's not coming out right. I will rant on this later, but for now I will take a lighter note.

I think I have the ultimate tool, a weapon we can use to right the wrongs on not only our own planet, but our galaxy. Evil will tremble, heros will rise, and sandwichs will taste their ultimate best because... just cause. But it's not something all can carry, only the select few can hold it with pride and use it for it's destined use. Are you one of them? Can the lightsaber be held in your hand? 

Yes, I bought a really cheap plastic lightsaber at toys 'r' us, but it's awesome because we just beat the crap out of each other with them.

I saw Million Dollar Baby, and I suggest you go do so as soon as possible. The movie is fantastic, and if you think it's just a boxing movie then I will hit you with this two by hour next time I see you. I have a two by four right next to me, don't doubt my l33t wood skillz.


You know what is really weird? When I'm talking to people on AIM I hit enter and the message doesn't send. I don't mean like it dissapears and just isn't delievered, I mean it just sits in the type box thing and waits for me to do something. So I kill it, you got a problem with that. Gah I feel boring lately, I will go to the secret comedy camp to change that.

Commercials are the only reason to watch the Super Bowl.

So finished my research paper, killed that fool good. Now I'm sitting here, drinking milk which is something I shouldn't be doing right now but it's just so good... so if you'll forgive the qoute "Milk was a bad choice!" Seriously though, I'm coughing up a lung and it sucks, so if anyone has one their not using... feel free to donate as one of mine is no lying on my keyboard.

I saw Cannibal: The Musical! Live!! last night, and it would have been great if it wasn't for this crappy comedian at the beginning named Brian or something. To make up for it I did do this:
Starship Captian! by Uberdude

And I am not sick! Nothing any of you do will get me to admit it!

I walked in my house tonight and found very two awesome books sitting by my stuff, and I find myself hoping muchly that they are for me. The first one is Shakespeare: A Collection of Quotations, and the other sitting by it was The Magic of the Movies: Quotable Moments From The Big Screen and both seem to be very awesome. Here's a quote for you Brandon:

"If my films make one more person miseable, I'll feel like I have done my job." -Woody Allen, director and writer

Me favorite keychain broke today, and the anger within me is... well rather neutral... it was just a really cool keychain.

I am so tired, I must finish this paper, and I got my first actual rejection letter today for my writing. Their reasons for rejecting me are not clear, but they may be somewhere in this part of the letter:

"The high school section of Hanging Loose began in 1968. It is intended to present the very best work being produced by the country's most accomplished teenage writers. It's not the right place to send poems and stories if you've just begun writing or if you've only submitted work because a teacher said you had to. HL does not print poems which read like greeting card rhymes or pop lyrics. Other common troubles include hastily written work with glaring errors; obvious imitations of well-known poems; vague generalizations about Love and Life; poems stuffed with cliches and tired language; and poems that are so private the reader cannot decipher them."


They were... nice about it... cough.
Had a two hour nap. Missed all homework. Nyquil knocking me out. Look for something exciting tomorrow.

Okay, it's not a tick, but I have this weird neurotic thing where I check my email... a lot. Mostly when I'm bored, but sometimes not even then, I just want to see if I got anything new. So please, feel free to e-mail me anytime for any reason if you have noting better to do.

A cop followed me home last night, and I know he followed me because I wasn't just driving down a straight road, stopped somewhere and he passed me, but here's how it went. I took a left into my neighberhood and so did this guy behind me who had just turned into my lane, the thing is that no one ever turns into my street. I go down my road cause I need to turn around, he's still behind me so I figure "I'll just go a bit more before I do a u-turn." I take a left. So does he. I go down to a koldisac(or however you spell it), turn onto it, and find my night friend is still behind me. I go all the way down, turn around... and so do they. I stop my friend Zach's car to tell him where my house is and the (what we are convinced is a)cop whistles this weird "get moving signal" so I go forward, and begin heading back to the street of my house... and they do the same thing. I park my car and they drive by, from what I caught of the license plate I knew it was probably undercover cop. But we checked our cars from time to time to make sure our stereos were still there.

That was confusing...

I got so much work to do right now it's pitiful, and this is just one more way to put it off. W00t for me in some ways. Yesterday I had the first practice where I had to learn to sing and... crap this is going to be tough. I am not a person of stage fright, in fact I never have been, but I've never had to sing in front of an entire audience before. I don't know what it is really, I mean I know I'm not the greatest singer but that doesn't stop me from randomly singing when I'm in crowds or whenever I really feel like it. I really shouldn't think, I should just do... in my own way. Well, if things were my way then this whole musical would be quite different, and at least involve a 20 minute battle scene that would not fit in anywhere. Why you ask? Because it's what the crowds wanna see. I think I'm gonna go get lunch.

I think the drama part is more accurate.

I have to do a report on ol' Ernest Hemingway, and I gots myself a stack of six books on the man, I am sure I will know more about him than I want to.

I've been watching people lately, they're becoming so destroyed by the relationship of another, and it has made me learn mor about myself than it has hurt me. True, I can't be around the two of them for my own reasons, but I can stand the idea now. Jamie called the girl's boyfriend "the devil" today, and I laughed. Lauren has become saddened because her best friend is being lost from her, and I am doing my best for the both of them while keeping myself in check. You don't learn who people are until a time of tragedy comes, even if it is their own personal one.

I have started writing my book, working title... none as of yet. But it is about my relationships with my friends and if you want to be in let me know so I can gather material up to put you in. I ask this because some people will be put in on my own free will, others will be in because they want to and I want them to.

I feel like I've been bettering myself lately, some strange silent motivation that gets me to be a bit stronger. I stopped doing the things that make me hate myself and the struggles with my problems become easier to win, and I sleep a lot better at night not feeling guilty. As much as I thought things were messed up they have become so much easier and clearer to me. I've finally figured this all out for me.

Brandon: I'm on the last few pages of your script, I've been distracted and just got to it. I love it and can't wait to see you put it into motion.
Ugh... it's getting harder... I have to carry on...

It's true, I was on for a couple of scenes and just sat around the rest of the time. Tension between certain cast members run high, emotions are already all over the place, and I can tell there will be more drama off stage then there will be on. I had to face some of my own anger today for the first time, I had to admit to something that was very painful... I had to do what I had to do. And I can't do it again because I have to be calm cool and collected, it's like people are expecting it off me in some odd, twisted way. I love my friends though, Jamie and I just sat at lunch, not talking, but listening to music... so at peace. Ryan and I started randomly singing Phantom of the Opera... it's great. And everyone else... you make me smile, and right now I really need that. Thank you. Everyone else... get cracking.

I really do mean to update this more, I guess it just slips my mind. I'll favorite it so I can look and be like "hey, livejournal."

I've really been into Ben Folds lately, not sure why exactly, but I just love his music. Ben Folds Five is good and all, but just Ben on his own is amazing. I have almost all of the CDs and so my iPod is half filled with just piano music. I need to put all my cds on there still, I have a lot more space to fill up... I'm just kind of rambling off, I'm not in the best of moods since I found out that the girl I like may be with a complete punk, but she doesn't know that he is a said punk. The only part that really pisses me off is that, from what I can collect, they may have been together for about a week and no one said one thing to me about it. I don't know anything for sure, so I have to play it all off like nothing is going on, and then eat people out when I find out it is true that no one told me. True, it's not my buisness to know, but it's that people seem to be going to extreme lengths to NOT tell me.

Gah, forget everything right now, I wanna go see a movie.

There will be no Hamper man this month due to conflicting schedules. When I called Hamper Man to see what he was doing this month I got his answering machine and found out that he is skiing in the old Hamper country where the laundry smells like a pine forest...

Happy Holidays folks.

Yes, I know I have rarely updated this, except for Hamper Man, and I'm goin to guess that not everyone really cares. Well, I haven't been up to much, being a sophmore isn't too hard, but Chemistry is kicking me while I'm down so that's always fun. I have my first final today and I'm killing time until I have to get ready, which is probably soon, and it sucks. Tonight I'll get to unwind though, so no worries. Unwind with my sweet sweet Kingdom Hearts: Chain of Memories... the game has taken my soul, and with good reason. I am so near to beating it that it is kind of sad I haven't yet, but I can/will after I level up a bit more.

I'm trying to make restitution for the past, so if I ever wronged you then I ask you accept my apologies now.

One fateful day, Hamper Man was partaking in his usual daily activities when a thought crossed his super human mind:

"I do believe that I have not seen the light of day for.... carry the two... 6 MONTHS! I should do something about this!"

6 MONTHS LATER

"Yep, I think I'll get started on that."

Innocently our hero grabs the door nob, determined to do what his mother would so often tell him to do. "Get off of your lazy butt, stop doing homework, and go injury yourself for insurance money!"

How wrong our galiant savior was! A gun toting Muslim of some sort was waiting outside for some reason!

"I am a terrorist, here to terrorize you! There has been a bounty placed on your head in the black market... the terrorist black market!" The one stop shop for all your terrifying needs!

Hamper Man, shocked by this shocking turn of events, exclaims "I must grab my-"

"BANG!" yells the dirty camel-face.

"BANG!" Continues the Middle Eastern sand-soldier.

Hamper Man, with his hamper-like speed and power, grabbed his sword, changed his clothes, and turned night into day! This moment of radical change took the muslim off gaurd, as his greatest fear is that of change, giving Hamper Man the perfect chance to attack!

"BANGIT! You have broken my gun!" he exclaimed in terror (the irony almost too sweet).

"You deserved it... camel-face." Responded our hero with his vast knowledge of racial slurs.

"BANG BANG BANG!" The muslim quickly goes to work, being a master craftsman... At least he's master at something useful, seeing as he sucks at everything else.

And the battle resumes.

In a very scripted turn of events, we see our favorite warrior pin the stereotypical failure of a villian to his eventual demise.

It's not over yet! It appears that some cheating has been done as the desert devil pulls out his concealed bag of anthrax! (As everyone knows, it is against paragraph 4, section 3, clause C of the "Second-rate Hero vs. Third-rate Villian handbook" to conceal sandwich bags of poisonous powder and/or fish with the intention of using it against your foe!)

"BANG!" Yells the Gun Totin' Muslim, as he has been affectionately deemed, with a dramatic arm raise above his head, rearing to throw the bag of powder at Hamper Man, once again proving his inability to use weaponry.

"POP!" Says the bag, as it does so, covering the cheater with his own uncannily flour-like powder.

Once again, our amazing Hamper Warrior has thwarted the forces of "evil". But has evil really failed, or has it thwarted Hamper Man from his original mission of leaving his secret bachelor pad?

HAMPER MAN

Cast

William "Bill" Bishop as Hamper Man

 Bijan "Amino Acid" Amini as Gun Totin' Muslim

Writing team

David "Dom" Luzader

William "Bill" Bishop

Director

Matthew "Miles" Hall

Hamper Man created by

Bill and Dom

Catering

Olive Garden

This has been a production of Hamper Man Inc.

 

 

Bijan Amini was nearly fired near the beginning of production, being caught on camera assaulting William Bishop. Asked later, Bijan blamed the outburst on the overdose of skittles.

 

"Hey, Bill here.  Once again, HUGE thanks to Dom for all the writing and work on the final edit, and 100% of the photography for this episode. He never ceases to amaze me. The 'Overdose of skittles' thing was partially true, and can be explained basically as: Dom had this skittles jar that had 'Never been emptied' and so, we vowed to, that night, completely rid that jar of it's candy-coated....candies. We did it, but Bijan got sick from all the skittles we forced him and everyone else at the party to eat. This is definately the best writing in any of the three Hamper Man episodes thus far, and all of you should give Dom a big round of applause. Then go tell all your friends of Hamper Man. Miles is our new director, and will be introduced in a later episode. Oh, and for all you fanatics, Hamper Man will soon have a domain name. Don't listen to Dom, and his, 'Bill, you've been saying that for months!' Well, that about wraps it up for me, so tune in next time for: 'Hamper Man: Origins'." ---Bill

"Woo-boy has this been a crazy adventure, and the stories! SO many to tell... but my lawyers just informed me that's in the best interest of everyone if I don't. I would like to introduce everyone to Bijan, a good friend of mine and the newest addition to our quickly growing team. As for this skittle jar, so soon as it was emptied I called upon the mighty powers of the skittles genie and a the jar was full again, true we had to sacrifice one member of the party to get the new skittles, but try and tell me it wasn't worth it. I don't really have much to say... except yeah Bill, you have been saying it for months, where is it already?!"  ---Dom

"No comments"---Bijan as he heads back to his trailer

"Life sucks." ---Miles

Welcome boys and girls, to the wonderful and... spooky stories from the bottom of the sock drawer. Yes, a lost story about everyone's favorite super hero, Hamper Man on this positivly freightful night. We join him now, as our story starts, and he begins his adventure on Halloween.

 

It appears our hero is planning to have another adventure again tonight, and to get ready for something so scary he must look the part!

But why be scary? Maybe he'll just have some fun as the resident Hillbilly!

Only some idiot on wellfare who just ate a half pan of methanfedamine brownies would break tradition. Our hero wouldn't do that so he will go as a SCARY MONSTER!

Why not combine the screams and laughter and be a... Scary... hill.. billy... monster.. thing... Moving on.

It is Halloween after all, maybe you can go as The Legally Blind Ninja!Patent pending, beware the ninja lawyers!

Oh, I see. You're going to be lame and hand out candy like some kind of lame lamer? That's fine. Lamer.

And so he did pass out the candy in his own lame way, and as the night went on out hero saw plenty of things.

He saw some funny costumes...

"Ha ha ha! Where'd you get your costume? Losers' R' Us?! Here, I'll give you nickel, go buy some originality."

 

We ask all pregnant women and easily frieghtened children, even you stoned college kids, look away as this may be too intense.

 

...and then there were some scary ones! Oh sweet dancing rhinos! Look away!

"AIEEEEE!!!"

Maybe that was too much for our hero. Looks like he's heading for bed...

"Ding Dong!" Oops, I lied, looks like Hamper Man has to deal with one more sugar driven ankle biter.

DUN DUN DUUUUN--!!

"Hello old friend, I have come for-"

"Revenge?!"

"No! CANDY!!"

"Oh! Well... sorry, I'm all out, how about this small dog instead?"

"Haha, no thank you. I have gotten FAR too many of those tonight."

 

Well! That was a close call, our hero doesn't need ANY trouble tonight. But we had so few visitors, how did you run out of candy so quickly?

"Uuuugh...."

Looks like someone had a good night! Haha, sleep well my comatose friend, sleep well.

 

THE END

 

...That was it? I dug through dirty clothes for three hours for that?! Hope it was better for you. Freaking cheapskates...

The holiday that bring everyone together. What's more and important: it brought me and Bill together to make Hamper Man halloween special. I need to double check a few things and then it will be up on here for everyone to enjoy! If I get into mood for it... today doesn't quite feel right for me. I felt like there was something more I could have done today, like I missed something. If anyone founds what I lost please return it, I will sleep easier with it tonight. Thank you.
Today, I was outside of existance. Go along your ways.

Why do I feel like... right now I can just fall backwards and the fall will never end. Why does it all seem so empty lately? I seriously hate it, I want to fix everything, but when I reach out to grab my problems they slip right out of my hands. I wish I was braver, I wish I didn't care, I wish with a few easy seconds I could take it all from my mind and make it all work out. I WISH I HAD ANSWERS.

One fine day, Hamper Man was happily playing Dance Dance Revolution... When all of a sudden,

His arch enemy, the Legally Blind Ninja ambushes him using his 3V1L L33T Skillz of the night!

Hamper Man quickly grabs his sword and shield!

"Prepare to fight!"

"Bring it!"

MORTAL KOMBAT!

And so they fought, Hamper Man and his Knight-In-Shining-Hamper-Like valor, and the Legally Blind Ninja, with whatever ninjas do.

And in a shocking turn of events, our hero, Hamper Man, has been disarmed of his trusty sword.

Using his incredible wit and laser-like-presicion he quickly removes the Legally Blind Ninja's glasses leaving him... legally blind.

Legally Blind Ninja fumbles around hopelessly as Hamper Man points and laughs.

Hamper Man then beats the Legally Blind Ninja with his down and dirty street fighting techniques.

VICTORY DANCE!   "Waka laka!" Sings our overjoyed hero.

So I haven't updated in a while, I keep telling myself that I'm going to, but I didn't get a chance till right now. I guess I have my reasons for not updating, and they mostly revolve around play practice. I get home so late that I just don't find the time to do jack before I fall into a deep sleep. Not deep enough though, as I've missed running many many times for the past like two weeks and it's not good, I'm starting to see a bit more of poundage on me and it's not good. I guess I just gatta deal with it and get off my ass... Ironic as i wear a fat suit in the play. I really should be thankful though, I've been given a lot of time to think and I've cleared a lot of things up, except almost killing Sean, sorry bud, it wasn't me or anything personally. So I will not dance away, until I got some good stories to tell, and trust me, they're coming.

Oh yes, and Hilary Dyff does not diserve a movie about MUSIC.


Random play part we made fun of:

Teddy: I beg your pardon! Who are you?
Johnathen(who looks like Borris Karloff): I'm Woodrow Wilson, now go to bed!
Teddy (real line): No, you're not Wilson, but your face IS familiar.
Teddy (line I did): My god Wilson what happened to you?!

Here's a poem I wrote today:

Empty Hopes Too Late:

Darkened skies of lonely hearts,
burn brightly to a dulled light.
Put out like a cigarette,
withered away to a garden's past,
forgiveness never given to its worth.
Tick away till the power dies,
sleep to insomnia's bitter end.
Drink from an empty glass,
fill it all to nothingness.
Save me from the water's edge,
but you let me slip away.
Sliding through hoplessness,
choking on the words I try to say.
One last look is all I ask,
one last look is all it takes...

Most Americans will not consider themselves "Patriotic", in fact, most don't even own a flag. If you mention anything pro-america some just ignore it, but there is one time...

A time where every one in this country is proud of who they are. This time is... THE OLYMPICS!

If you take away our gold medal, we'll friggen kill you.

So I had my audition for the school play yesterday, the title is Arsenic and Old Lace. I read for the part of Teddy, a crazy guy who thinks he is Theodore Roosevelt, and people told me I had done really well. Today I went back for the second audition, for every part with Teddy I was called up to read so I had an idea that it was mine. After my first little read through today, the director handed me a packet on Roosevelt's life and told me to read through it. She didn't quite tell me I had the part, but it was obvious. Then she announced the parts, I got Teddy and everyone else was cast perfectly. I have refearsel every day of every week until the play from 3-5:15. But I gatta be best I can, right?

HOLY CRAP! IT RAINED!

After three weeks of hoping, wishing, and cursing the clouds it finally happened. W00T!

School starts soon... but till then take this quiz!

1. Who are you?
2. Are we friends?
3. When and how did we meet?
4. How have I affected you?
5. What do you think of me?
6. What's the fondest memory you have of me?
7. How long do you think we will be friends?
8. Do you love me?
9. Do you have a crush on me?
10. Would you kiss me?
11. Would you hug me?
12. Physically, what stands out?
13. Emotionally, what stands out?
14. Do you wish I was cooler?
15. On a scale of 1-10, how do I compare against your other friends?
16. Give me a nickname and explain why you picked it.
17. Am I loveable?
18. How long have you known me?
19. Describe me in one word.
20. What was your first impression?
21. Do you still think that way about me now?
22. What do you think my weakness is?
23. Do you think I'll get married?
24. What makes me happy?
25. What makes me sad?
26. What reminds you of me?
27. If you could give me anything what would it be?
29. How well do you know me?
29. When's the last time you talked to me?
30. Ever wanted to tell me something but couldn't? If so, will you tell me now?
31. Do you think I could kill someone?
32. Do you think our friendship is getting stronger/weaker/or staying the same?
33. Do you feel that you could talk to me about anything and I would listen?
34. Are you going to put this on your LiveJournal and see what I say about you?

There was this one guy who did nothing. And then... THE UNIVERSE WAS CREATED! And the guy had a mild heart attack from shock. Left unchecked, his condition did not improve much. Yet again... LIFE SPRANG FORTH! And he suffered yet another heart attack. Then the guy took a vacation, to some long forgotten planet. After reading the long works of himself he put them in a sling shot and shot them to Earth. Sadly, he did not know much about gravity, space, or physics so he pretty much wiped out all of the life in one firey piece of literature. He then returned back home to find something else... NEW LIFE CAME FORTH! And he suffered two heart attacks, fell down, and hit his head on some passing by rock that is forever caught in the Earth's orbit. When he came to he found a complete civilization with giant metal towers and something he curiously dubbed as "Loud-mouthed New Yorker"s. Yes, playing Final Fantasy: Chrystal Chronicles alone is fun, but so much more could be done with atleast one more person. I have to say, it's a well rounded game that works well either way. The battle system is easy to use and quick succesion, except for spell casting which is a bitch. All the tribes are pretty cool, and eventually I'll a character from each one. But I really want to play with three other people in a regular group so that everyone can have a specific role. And I somehow perfer the gameboy to the controller, it just feels like that's how it should be.

I really missed Sara today. She told me not to call her from Samurai and I was really sad so I was missing her all day. I wanted to call her, but she told me not to and I respect her to the highest degree. She didn't want me to call so I didn't, but I felt really sad.

Otherwise today was good, I got to help judge the tournament which started late, but it was ok. I picked up Brandon's book, Paper Sailboat, picked up some comics, and other things I can't post because of a certain someone who reads this. When I checked the preview box for next week I saw NYX, was told to look just at the last page and I was like "Holy Shit! This is awesome!" Hear that Matt, when NYX 3 comes out next week just look at the last page and tell me if iy doesn't look cool. Out of hunger we went to Taco Bell to get munchables in a Taco Bell full of christians. It turns out it was Aquire the Fire weekend, and I know my youth group was there. After picking up Challupas we sat in traffic for 30 minutes on one street... inching towards Seventh while talking about old Power Rangers, VR Troopers, Digimon, and Beetle Borgs. Shane had to go to the bathroom pretty bad and seemed ready to kill the next person in his way. I was in the seat right next to him. I was spared and we finally got to Samurai where Shane got to the bathroom and we started club. Then we did club, got that out of the way, and put in some Family Guy. We watch the "banned" episode to see what it was all about. Let's just say you know you're in a group of nerds when everyone laughs really hard at an Optomis Prime is Jewish joke. I came, I saw, I conquered. Then we played besm where Bijan finally got a good ship as compared to the one that feel apart in the middle of space. The quest wasn't much, but it was fun to hear Bijan complain about not being able to move and being completly paralyzed from his own ship. We finally got things through, but had to end at a sort of half way point in the game where we were apparantly attacked by aliens. Then there was the racist jokes. How hard we laughed, and there is nothing better than a car full of people telling racist jokes, not meaning to be racist, but just to be funny. Here's my favorite, if you are offended than don't read:






This guy is driving down the road talking on his cellphone, not really paying attention, and all of a sudden he looks up to see two black guys walking across the road. It's too late, he hits his breaks, buts hits them both and sends one of them through the windsheild and into the back seat and the other flies over a fence. Both are dead and the guy is panicing so he calls the cops. "I don't know what happened," he said, "I was driving and these two were just in front of me, I couldn't stop in time." The cop said, "it's ok. I'll just get that guy for breaking and entering and the other fucker for running from an accident."
